content: A fire broke out at a plant of the JSW Steel company in Maharashtra's Palghar district early Thursday morning, officials said. title: Rupee averts record low on cenbank intervention as tariff clouds darken | Stock Market News
description: By Jaspreet Kalra MUMBAI, Sept 26 (Reuters) - The Indian rupee managed to hold above its all-time low on Friday, supported by likely central bank intervention, even as steep U.S. tariffs on branded drug imports compounded lingering concerns over a hit to trade and foreign portfolio flows. The domest
content: By Jaspreet Kalra MUMBAI, Sept 26 (Reuters) - The Indian rupee managed to hold above its all-time low on Friday, supported by likely central bank intervention, even as steep U.S. tariffs on branded drug imports compounded lingering concerns over a hit to trade and foreign portfolio flows. The domestic currency was expected to open near and dip past its lifetime low of 88.7975 at the open, which it avoided largely due to intervention from the Reserve Bank of India, traders said.

content: The $14 billion price tag proposed for TikTok’s US business values it more like a stuffy old energy or food company than a leading global social media company. The rough estimate, cited by Vice President JD Vance on Thursday, is well below previous projections that scaled closer to $40 billion. Vance’s comments came as President Donald Trump pushed forward a plan for American investors to buy the US operation from Chinese internet firm ByteDance Ltd.

The Asian food titan slumped as much as 3.8% in Singapore to the lowest since February 2016 on an intraday basis, before clawing back some losses. Wilmar announced the Supreme Court decision in a filingBloomberg Terminal after market on Thursday.

content: By Akash Sriram -U.S. tech shares were little changed on Monday after President Donald Trump announced a $100,000 one-time fee for H-1B visas, part of his immigration crackdown that has raised concerns about higher labor costs and limited access to skilled workers. The H-1B program allows U.S. employers to hire foreign workers in specialty fields such as technology and engineering, and higher fees threaten to raise labor costs for tech companies that depend heavily on this talent pipeline.

content: By Arathy Somasekhar HOUSTON (Reuters) -Oil prices edged lower on Monday as worries of an oversupply outweighed geopolitical tensions in Russia and the Middle East. content: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh on Monday announced the opening of a new Defence Wing at the Indian Embassy in Rabat as India and Morocco moved to scale up their defence ties. Singh, who held talks with his Moroccan counterpart Abdeltif Loudiyi, signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) on defence cooperation that lays out an institutional framework for collaboration. The pact covers defence industry cooperation, joint exercises, military training and capacity building.
